title: Srimad Bhagavatam | Sri Atma Tattva Dasa | SB 2.1.14 | 04.01.2026
speaker: HG Atma Tattva Dasa

segments.text: And Krishna says in the next sloka that there is a superior substance and matter, superior entity.
And what is it? It is the spirit soul.
So the superior energy is one which is exploiting this matter.
And it is, the name given by the Lord is Jitabhutam.
And if the soul is energy, then the law of conservation of energy should hold good for the soul too.
So that explains that yes, we do exist after life.
And Krishna makes it more clear in the second chapter.
In fact, the Bhagavad Gita starts from here.
Dehino asliyatha dehe ghaumaryam yoganam jara
Krishna is saying yes, there is a matter.
And there is a Dehi, which is energy, superior energy.
And this energy goes under transformations in different phases.
What happens next? What happens after jara, after old age?
Ghaumaryam said the end. He didn't say the end.
Next transformation is a new body.
Krishna is saying yes, you exist after life, after old age, after death.
And you go, you pass into another body.
They understood till here whatever Krishna was saying.
Yeah, there is a matter, there is energy.
This whole world is a combination of matter and energy.
They have no idea how it happens.
Only Dheeras they understand and they don't get stuck.
Not everybody will understand or everybody will appreciate.
So why scientists got stuck here?
Why they are not able to understand this also?
There are so many learned people in the world.

What other Krishna says, as it is.

How the soul is currently staying in the body.
They can't see that the soul is sitting there.

They don't understand what goes wrong.
They can't see the soul leaving the body.
How the soul is staying in the heart in this matter.
But how it is experiencing the interactions of three modes.
Finally when it leaves the body that also they cannot see.
There is a book called Coming Back. In that book there is a letter by a heart surgeon.
He wrote an open letter in the newspaper that I want to understand what is going on.
And somehow one of the disciples of Prabhupada brought that newspaper to Prabhupada.
That there is a heart surgeon and he wants to know.
Because he had done so many heart surgeries.
He imagined in that letter that I have experienced the life passing between my fingers.
Then Prabhupada wrote a letter back to him explaining what soul is, what are the attributes and how to perceive it.

Because the whole process of scientific discoveries or understanding is based on observation.
I remember in my science class, science when we go to the lab, we have a lab manual we used to write there.
The first thing we write is observations.
Then comes the theory, then comes the experiment, then conclusion.
And all our observations are limited by our senses.
So whatever we know about our surroundings is because of these Gyanendriyas.
They capture the information around the surrounding and that's how we get them out.
And they are limited, so our observations are limited.
They are faulty, so our observations are faulty.
We cannot see everything with the eyes.
And with the same eyes, we design telescopes.
With the same eyes, we design microscopes.
With the help of this eye which has so many limitations and so many faults.
So how the product of this eye which is faulty and which is limited can be perfect and without limit.
And that's where the significance of the scriptures come into place.
Something which you cannot perceive by your senses can be perceived by the scriptures.
Whereas what scientists can tell us is limited because the senses are limited.
That's why the new scientist comes and he says, no, whatever the previous scientist said is wrong.
And this keeps happening after every 50-100 years.

And finally the heart. Hridayam, heart is compared to asamsaram.
It is like a steel frame, frame of a steel.
If, na vikrayatatha, if it does not melt.
